Assuming all blocks are wooden and have similar properties, their interactions should follow standard collision physics.
Conservation of Momentum: The total momentum before and after the collision remains the same, provided no external forces are acting.
Conservation of Energy: In an elastic collision, kinetic energy is conserved.
In real-world scenarios, collisions are often inelastic to some degree, meaning some energy is lost as heat, sound, or deformation.
